description.other_details: Ian McNicoll, Ocean Informatics, UK, ian.mcnicoll@oceaninformatics.com

IHE Eye Care Domain. General Eye Evaluation (GEE) [Internet]. IHE; 2012. Available from: http://www.ihe.net/Technical_Framework/upload/IHE_EyeCare_Supp_GEE_Rev1-1_TI_2012-06-29.pdf
Royal College of Opthalmologists. Cataract National Dataset for Adults [Internet]. 2011. Available from: http://www.rcophth.ac.uk/page.asp?section=583&sectionTitle=Cataract+National+Data+Set+for+Adults

Eye Color [Internet]. Wikipedia. Available from: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_color
Pupillary abnormalities [Internet], openEyes Project. Available from: http://www.openeyes.org.uk/elements/pupil/pupil.html

details.purpose: For recording the findings on physical examination of the pupils.
details.use:
Use to record the findings on physical examination of the pupils.
Use to incorporate the narrative descriptions of clinical findings within existing or legacy clinical systems into an archetyped format, using the 'Clinical Description' data element.
Specifically designed to be used within the OBSERVATION.exam archetype, but may be used within any clinically appropriate ENTRY or CLUSTER archetype.
details.misuse: Not to be used to record findings of the physical examination of other parts of the eye, such as the retina - use other specific archetypes for this purpose.

details.purpose: Za dokumentiranje opazovanj zenic v ZN
details.use: Uporablja se za opazovanje zenic v ZN

items.items: Findings on physical examination of the pupils.
Pupil constricts with light shone into that eye.
Findings of the consensual pupillary light reflex.
Findings of the pupillary accommodation reflex.
Identification of the pupil under examination.
A text description of the estimated pupil size.
The pupil is constricted, relative to normal (1.5-2.5mm).
The pupil is dilated, relative to normal (>= 5.5mm).
The direct light reflex is present.
The direct light reflex is absent.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings of the pupil, not captured in other fields.
The direct light reflex is slow or sluggish (-).
The direct light reflex is of normal speed (+/-).
The direct light reflex is brisk (+).
The direct light reflex is very brisk (++).
The consensual light reflex is present.
The consensual light reflex is absent.
The consensual light reflex is sluggish or slow (-).
The consensual light reflex is of normal speed (+/-).
The consensual light reflex is brisk (+).
The accomodation light reflex is present.
The accommodation light reflex is absent.
The accommodation light reflex is slow or sluggish (-).
The accommodation light reflex is of normal speed (+/-).
The accommodation light reflex is brisk (+).
The pupil is a normal, circular shape.
The pupil is an abnormal shape.
The pupil is an oval shape.
Findings of the relative afferent pupillary defect.
A relative afferent afferent pupillary defect (RAPD) is absent.
A relative afferent afferent pupillary defect (RAPD) is present.
Single word, phrase or brief description representing a summary of the examination findings applying to both puplis.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, SNOMED-CT|386667005| Pupils equal, react to light and accommodation|.
Narrative description of findings observed during a physical examination of the pupil.
Use this data element to provide additional, narrative description of any data elements that are represented only by structured values.
Multimedia image taken during examination of the identified pupil.
An estimate of the equality of the size and shape of the pupils.
The pupils are of equal size.
The puils are of unequal size.
Physical examination findings of an identified pupil.
Single word, phrase or brief description representing a summary of the examination findings applying to a single pupil.
Multimedia image taken during examination of both pupils.
*Pupil constricts with light shone into that eye.(en)
*Findings of the consensual pupillary light reflex.(en)
*A text description of the estimated pupil size.(en)
*The pupil is constricted, relative to normal (1.5-2.5mm).(en)
*The pupil is dilated, relative to normal (>= 5.5mm).(en)
Refleks na direktno svetlobo je prisoten
Refleks na direktno svetlobo ni prisoten
*Additional narrative about the physical examination findings of the pupil, not captured in other fields.(en)
Refleks na direktno svetlobo je počasen (-)
*The direct light reflex is of normal speed (+/-).(en)
Refleks na direktno svetlobo je hiter (+)
Refleks na direktno svetlobo je zelo hiter (++)
Refleks na indirektno svetlobo je prisoten
Refleks na indirektno svetlobo ni prisoten
Refleks na indirektno svetlobo je počasen (-)
Refleks na indirektno svetlobo je normalno hiter (+/-)
Refleks na indirektno svetlobo je hiter (+)
*Findings of the relative afferent pupillary defect.(en)
*A relative afferent afferent pupillary defect (RAPD) is absent.(en)
*A relative afferent afferent pupillary defect (RAPD) is present.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description representing a summary of the examination findings.(en)
*Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, SNOMED-CT|386667005| Pupils equal, react to light and accommodation|.(en)
*Narrative description of findings observed by a clinician during a physical examination of the pupil.(en)
*Use this data element to provide additional, narrative description of any data elements that are represented only by structured values.(en)
*Multimedia image taken during examination of the pupil.(en)
*An estimate of the equality of the size of the pupils.(en)
